answers.answer: HiObesity in childhood and adolescence can be due to hormonal and genetic factors. The endocrinal disorders suspected as causes of endogenous obesity include hypothyroidism and hypercortisolism (Cushing's syndrome). It can also be due to binge eating, an eating disorder characterized by episodes of uncontrollable overeating.Obesity is associated with significant morbidity, including hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, hyperlipidemia and hyperuricemia.You should consult an endocrinologist for a proper assessment of your condition. Treatment plans should include medical management of the underlying disorder (if any), weight-loss programme, dietary and physical activity management, nutritional education, behavior modification and family involvement. Examples of modifying eating behavior include taking smaller bites, chewing food longer, putting the fork down between bites and leaving some food on the plate.You should maintain a food dairy, which should include not only the type and quantity of food eaten, but also where it was eaten and the time of day and who else was present.Interpersonal Psychotherapy (IPT), a form of psychotherapy that has been adapted for the treatment of eating disorders.Do write in if you need some additional information.Take care!
